label: logicC:politics_en
steps: [1] If the governing coalition holds a majority vote for the bill, then the bill passes the legislature.
[2] If the bill passes the legislature, then it is presented to the head of state for signature.
[3] If the bill is presented to the head of state for signature and the head of state signs it, then the bill becomes law.
[4] The head of state signs the bill.
[5] The governing coalition holds a majority vote for the bill.
[6] For every candidate x, if x meets the legal eligibility requirements, then x is qualified to run for office.
[7] Candidate a meets the legal eligibility requirements.
[8] For every candidate x, if x is qualified to run for office, then x either secures party endorsement or runs as an independent.
[10] The bill is presented to the head of state for signature.
[12] Candidate a is qualified to run for office and either secures party endorsement or runs as an independent.
